name: Bicycles
description: Two-wheeled, human-powered vehicle for commuting, exercise, and recreation.

name: Car
description: Four-wheeled motor vehicle, typically used for personal transportation and short-distance travel.

name: Train
description: Rail vehicle that travels on tracks, often used for long-distance passenger and freight transport.

name: Airplane
description: Fixed-wing aircraft that flies through the air, used for long-distance travel and air cargo.

name: Bus
description: Road vehicle designed to carry multiple passengers, often used for public transportation.

name: Boat
description: Watercraft of various sizes and shapes, used for transportation, recreation, and fishing.

name: Motorcycle
description: Two-wheeled motor vehicle with a single seat or sidecar, typically used for personal transportation and sport.

name: Tram
description: Rail vehicle that runs on tracks along streets, often used for urban transportation.

name: Truck
description: Large motor vehicle designed to transport goods, often used for commercial freight transport.

name: Ferry
description: A boat or ship used to transport passengers, vehicles, or goods across a body of water, such as rivers or seas.

name: Streetcar
description: A rail-based public transport vehicle running on tracks in streets, often seen in urban areas.

name: Metro
description: An underground or elevated railway system used for public transportation within cities or urban areas.

name: Scooter
description: Two-wheeled motorized or non-motorized vehicle for personal transport, typically smaller than motorcycles.

name: Tractor
description: Heavy-duty vehicle used primarily in agriculture for towing, plowing, and other farm tasks.

name: Ropeway
description: Transport system using suspended cables or ropes to carry passengers or goods, often across difficult terrains or over short distances.

name: Ship
description: Large watercraft designed for navigation in deep waters, used for transportation of goods and passengers across oceans and seas

name: Limousine
description: Luxurious, elongated car typically chauffeured, offering comfort and prestige for special occasions or executive transport

name: Jetpack
description: Personal propulsion device worn on the back, enabling short-distance flight through jet propulsion, often used for experimental or recreational purposes

name: Houseboat
description: A floating home designed for living on water, often equipped with amenities similar to a house, used for leisure or as a permanent residence on rivers, lakes, or canals

name: Helicopter
description: Aircraft capable of vertical takeoff and landing, using rotating blades to fly forward,

name: Van
description: Motor vehicle primarily designed for transporting goods or cargo, commonly used by courier services or businesses for logistical purposes.

name: Dump Truck
description: Heavy-duty vehicle with an open-box bed that tilts, used for transporting and unloading bulk materials, commonly seen in construction and mining..

name: Ambulance
description: Emergency vehicle equipped with medical apparatus to transport patients, providing rapid medical care en route to hospitals or healthcare facilities.

name: Auto Rickshaw
description: Three-wheeled motorized vehicle used for short-distance transportation in urban areas, often a common mode of taxi service in many countries.

name: Taxi
description: is a type of vehicle for hire with a driver, used by a single passenger or small group of passengers, often for a non-shared ride.

name: Rickshaw
description: two-wheeled vehicle with a doorless, chairlike body and a collapsible hood, which holds one or two passengers and is drawn by a man between two shafts.

name: Hot Air Balloon
description: Lighter-than-air aircraft for leisure or scientific research.

name: Airship
description: Slow but offers unique sightseeing experiences.

name: Barge
description: Cargo transportation on inland waterways.

name: Cargo bike
description: Human-powered transport for small cargo loads.

name: Bullock Cart
description: Animal-drawn or human-powered vehicle for short-distance transport.

name: Chairlift
description: An elevated passenger ropeway, or chairlift, is a type of aerial lift, which consists of a continuously circulating steel wire rope loop strung between two end terminals and usually over intermediate towers, carrying a series of chairs.

name: Dog sled
description: Traditional transport in snowy regions, often used for racing.

name: Drone
description: Unmanned aerial vehicle for delivery, surveillance, or filmmaking.

name: Elephant
description: Used for transportation in Southeast Asia, ethical concerns exist.

name: Funicular
description: A funicular is a mountain railway designed to traverse a slope or climb and is usually used to go up and down.

name: Gondola
description: Boat used for transportation in canals or lagoons.

name: Hang glider
description: Glider launched from a cliff or mountain, controlled by body movements.

name: Horseback riding
description: Traditional mode of transport and leisure activity.

name: Hovercraft
description: Air-cushioned vehicle that travels over land and water.

name: Jet ski
description: Personal watercraft for recreational use.

name: Maglev train
description: High-speed train using magnetic levitation, not widespread yet.

name: Monorail
description: A rail is a railway in which the track is made of a single rail or beam.

name: Moped Scooter
description: Small gasoline-powered motor scooter.

name: Mule
description: Hybrid breed of horse and donkey used for pack carrying.

name: Oxcart
description: Animal-drawn cart used for agriculture and transportation.

name: Paraglider
description: Lightweight foot-launched glider dependent on wind currents.

name: Subway
description: Subway trains are used to transport large numbers of passengers within urban and suburban areas.

name: Tram
description: Electrically powered tram on city streets.

name: Snowmobile
description: Motorized vehicle for travel on snow or ice.

name: Sledges
description: Animal-drawn vehicle used on snow or ice.

name: Segway
description: Self-balancing electric scooter for personal mobility.

name: Sailboat
description: Wind-powered boat for leisure or racing.

name: Roller skates
description: Recreational activity, requires balance and skill.

name: Rocket
description: Used for spacecraft launches and space exploration.

name: Pedal scooter
description: Human-powered kick scooter for short distances.

name: Bamboo train
description: The bamboo train (norry) is powered by a small petrol belt engine with a rudimentary timber beam foot brake - fascinating.

name: Caballito de totora
description: Traditional reed boat made from totora reeds, used by the Uros people on Lake Titicaca in Peru.

name: Jeepney
description: Colorful and iconic public transportation in the Philippines, originally made from surplus military jeeps.

name: Zipline
description: Aerial cable mechanism consisting of a pulley suspended on a cable, usually made of stainless steel, mounted on a slope.

name: Jumbo Truck
description: Colloquial term for large, wide-body commercial airplanes, such as the Boeing 747. Known for their significant size and capacity for long-haul flights.

name: Songthaew
description: Shared passenger vehicle in Southeast Asia, especially in Thailand.

name: Hydrofoil
description: A hydrofoil is a lifting surface, or foil, that operates in water. They are similar in appearance and purpose to aerofoils used by aeroplanes.

name: Cyclo
description: Three-wheeled bicycle taxi with a passenger seat in the front, often used for short-distance transportation in Southeast Asian cities.

name: Hand-Pulled Rickshaw
description: Human-powered vehicle with a two-wheeled carriage, often used for short-distance transport in some urban areas. Pulled by a person, typically walking or running.

name: Dhow
description: Traditional sailing vessel with one or more masts, commonly used in the Arabian Peninsula and Indian Ocean regions. Dhows are often characterized by their distinctive lateen sails.

name: Duck Boat
description: Amphibious vehicle designed for both land and water travel.

name: Eurostar Train
description: High-speed train service connecting major cities in Europe, notably linking London with cities like Paris, Brussels, and Amsterdam through the Channel Tunnel.

name: Crane
description: Heavy machinery used for lifting and moving heavy objects.

name: Mixer truck
description: Heavy-duty vehicle designed to transport freshly mixed concrete from the batching plant to construction sites, equipped with a rotating drum for continuous mixing during transit.

name: JCB
description: Heavy equipment commonly used in construction and excavation, combining a front shovel/bucket and a rear digging arm/backhoe.

name: Fire Brigade
description: Fire brigade, also known as fire engines, are specialized vehicles equipped with firefighting apparatus and tools, designed to respond rapidly to emergency situations, extinguishing fires and providing rescue and disaster response services.

name: Coco Taxi
description: Coco Taxi: Three-wheeled, motorized, yellow and black scooter taxis commonly found in Cuba, offering a unique and efficient mode of urban transportation.

name: Camel bus
description: Articulated or double-decker bus with a hump-like design resembling a camel's back, often used in public transportation systems for increased passenger capacity.

name: Van
description: Multi-purpose vehicles used for transporting goods or people.

name: School Bus
description: Dedicated vehicles for transporting students to and from schools.

name: Camel
description: Camels, known as the ships of the desert are resilient and efficient modes of transport, well-adapted to arid landscapes, capable of carrying heavy loads for long distances.

name: Spacecraft
description: Spacecraft are vehicles designed for travel or operation in outer space.

name: Container ships
description: Efficiently carry standardized cargo containers over long distances.

name: Helicopters
description: Helicopters are versatile rotary-wing aircraft capable of vertical takeoff, landing, and hovering, with the ability to maneuver in any direction.

name: Gliders
description: Sailplanes utilizing wind currents for sustained flight without an engine.

name: Kayak
description: Small, narrow watercraft paddled with a double-bladed paddle.

name: Electric skateboard
description: Skateboard with an electric motor for propulsion.

name: Submarine
description: Watercraft capable of underwater operation for naval purposes.

name: Hyperloop
description: Hyperloop is a proposed high-speed transportation system that uses magnetically levitating capsules within low-pressure tubes to achieve rapid transit speeds.
